name: Akudo
headline: India's first learning-focused neobank for teenagers
description:
Akudo is a digital bank for teenagers in India that gets them their own sleek, personalized prepaid card that they can use independently, helps them save money and gives them exciting rewards under a gamified setup when they're good at their personal finance.  
We are crafting the concept of "Learning-first Banking" where financial learning is seamlessly intertwined with full scale banking.

generated_description:
Akudo is a pioneering fintech startup based in Bengaluru, India, focused on revolutionizing how teenagers engage with finance. Founded in 2020 and part of Y Combinator's Summer 2021 batch, Akudo's mission is clear: to be India's first learning-focused neobank tailored specifically for adolescents.

At its core, Akudo offers teenagers their own sleek, personalized prepaid cards that empower them to manage money independently and responsibly. But there's more to it than just banking. Akudo is embedding financial education into the banking experience through a concept they call "Learning-first Banking." This means that as young users navigate their finances, they’re also picking up essential skills and knowledge along the way.

The platform gamifies the learning process, providing rewards for good financial habits and saving, keeping it engaging and interactive. With a team of 20 passionate employees, Akudo is committed to crafting a future where financial literacy is second nature to the next generation.

In short, Akudo isn’t just a bank; it's an innovative platform shaping the financial habits of teenagers in India, turning the sometimes daunting world of personal finance into an accessible and rewarding journey. 

Check them out at [akudo.in](https://www.akudo.in/).
